alert.note: Alert for Adair; Boyle; Casey; Clinton; Cumberland; Garrard; Lincoln; Madison; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 3:43PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lincoln, northern Clinton, Garrard, Russell, central Boyle, northeastern Cumberland, southwestern Madison, Casey and southeastern Adair Counties through 415 PM EST/315 PM CST/... At 343 PM EST/243 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Danville to Liberty to 12 miles northeast of Columbia to 7 miles northeast of Burkesville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Liberty and Danville around 350 PM EST. Stanford around 355 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Jamestown and Lancaster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST/700 PM CST/ for south central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Boyle; Casey; Clinton; Cumberland; Garrard; Lincoln; Madison; Russell
